title: My CK comic art
content:
One day I hope to start a regular CK comic strip, but for now I'm just messing around. Comments please... especially whether or not you can tell what is going on in the strip, and of course your opinions are welcome. I'll post more stuff here later.

Thanks for the help.

[img]http://i206.photobucket.com/albums/bb125/bt-01/CK_sCrap__Practice_comic_6_by_BT_01.jpg[/img]

title: Re: My CK comic art
content:
Oh *Beautiful!*

It has elements reminiscent of Calvin and Hobbes, which I love; Keen has an air of carefree investigation and bold exploration about him. The details you put in are great and I love the way you shade and crosshatch.[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!

title: Re: My CK comic art
content: That is fucking awesome. You are my hero.[center]<font color="MAROON">TOUGH GUYS DON'T FOLLOW FADS</font>[/center]

title: Re: My CK comic art
content:
Agree, this stuff is excellent. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img] I too was reminded of Calvin and Hobbes a bit, mostly because of Keen in the first panel.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"

title: Re: My CK comic art
content:
Well it's settled. No more Keen fan art for me. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dead.gif[/img]

Seriously... What LL said. This looks a LOT like Calvin and Hobbes.

In fact, the amount of detail you put into this is quite astounding. You were able to make it cartoony yet detailed.

I like. I really like. Yes I was most definitely able to tell what is going on in the strip... something I was never able to master within my own comics. It's very simple and organized.-----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.

title: Re: My CK comic art
content:
Thank you Thank you! I honestly appreciate your the comments! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

I am a huge C&H fan, so the comparison is really a compliment for me. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Here's a picture of Mortimer McMire that I did recently... That picture on his shirt is supposed to be this Japanese character called "[url=http://www.chax.net/frameset.html]Gloomy Bear[/url]" (not associated with CK, but here's the [img]http://s206.photobucket.com/albums/bb125/bt-01/?action=viewt=xgloomy.jpg[/img]) which just seemed to fit Mort's personality, but looking at it now, I'm not sure if that was such a good idea. Maybe a more readily recognizable (and less violent) logo or something would have been better? At any rate, here it is....

[img]http://i206.photobucket.com/albums/bb125/bt-01/CK__Mortimer_McMire_by_BT_01.jpg[/img]

Also, here's another picture of Keen I did quite a while ago. (Production IG is yet another anime reference). The gun in his left hand isn't anything specific, I just wanted to make something that was really detailed and/or complex (if not entirely functional).

Hope you enjoy these. Comments/critisizms/etc welcome. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
Thanks again.

[img]http://i206.photobucket.com/albums/bb125/bt-01/Commander_Keen_by_BT_01.jpg[/img][img]http://www.chax.net/frameset.html[/img]

title: Re: My CK comic art
content:
Whoaly shit. Awesome stuff. About Mort's shirt -- I don't think he would (again, just my opinion!) have any logos in his clothes, except maybe something MM to represent himself. He might also like using more 'old-fashioned' appearance as suggested in some fan work -- ie. no t-shirt and jeans but... something, I don't know clothing. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-embarrassed.gif[/img] That skull in flames, while looking good, doesn't fit either, in my opinion -- for the same reasons. Always fun to see Mort stuff. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img]

Hehe, and great Keen pics. The shooting Keen reminds me of allstories's Keen style!3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: My CK comic art
content:
Heehee... Yeah, I'm on [url=http://bt-01.deviantart.com/]DeviantArt[/url], but I figureed if I'm doing CK stuff, it might be a good idea to post then to a Keen-specific area too. Thanks for noticing! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] )

As for Mort's stuff, I do think I try making him a bit more sinister than in the actual game... My image of him is that he's the kind of character that hardly ever talks and hardly ever changes that expression... just scowls all the time... the skull was intended to add a bit more ... uh.... sinister-ness... I'll have to work on that though. As for the shirt, I've always liked when characters had shirts with logos for some reason. It would be a good idea to try something more than a t-shirt... what else do kids wear? .....

Here's another one based on something I would do in the game all the time. (You did it too. Admit it! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] ) This probably takes place in the days before -- or after -- the whole Vorticon "mind control-belt" thing.

Thank you again for the comments!

[img]http://i206.photobucket.com/albums/bb125/bt-01/CK0003.jpg[/img]

[Edit] Ah, heck.. One more. No context for this one, just thought the idea would be funny. Though I realize now the Note box should stay Omnispeak instead of Standard Galactic.

The art's kind of cruddy, but it's just practice.. right?

[img]http://i206.photobucket.com/albums/bb125/bt-01/scrap-12.jpg[/img]

title: Re: My CK comic art

title: Re: My CK comic art
content:
Man, you're too good. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Hehe. Love the idea in the foob comic.

Yes -- my idea of him is that he's sinister. And pictures of him in t-shirts and logos, they work the opposite on me, making him seem less sinister and less serious with his plans to bring the Universe down. What I mean with other clothes is like a suit, or something a stereotypical kid genius would wear in a movie, you know, clothes that other kids would wear only in funeral or something, and even then only if they have to. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Well, keep up the good work.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: My CK comic art
content:
Hi. Great comics. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

I've used to picture Mort in a black t-shirt with black pants, like in GBC. But I've been learning how to draw manga, so now I see him in a sort of Japnese School uniform-type outfit.
[url=http://www.mangatutorials.com/tut/uboy.htm]Here's some different styles.[/url]
I think he'd look best in either a sweater-vest-kind of outfit, or a darker version of the school uniform they wear in Yu-Gi-Oh. Maybe a mixture of the two.

...But that's just my opinion.

PS: I might start working on a manga-style Keen comic. If not, I'll at least draw some fan art in the style.-Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Re: My CK comic art
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Yes -- my idea of him is that he's sinister. And pictures of him in t-shirts and logos, they work the opposite on me, making him seem less sinister and less serious with his plans to bring the Universe down. What I mean with other clothes is like a suit, or something a stereotypical kid genius would wear in a movie, you know, clothes that other kids would wear only in funeral or something, and even then only if they have to. Well, keep up the good work.[hr][/quote]Ah.. Now I see what you mean. Well, to explain my philosophy on Mort's design a little further, I was going for a sinister/cute/cool look (becaue the bad guys always look the coolest). Hence, the "cute" skull with flames. I gave him a t-shirt with jeans basically to make him the "inverse" of CK. I cosidered black jeans, but that seemed like it would be too much the black. Though now that you mention it, a black suit with black pants and a red tie (loosely worn) might look cool. Hmmmmmm.....

[quote]Quote:[hr]PS: I might start working on a manga-style Keen comic. If not, I'll at least draw some fan art in the style.[hr][/quote]I definitely want to see CK done in manga-style... I'm not sure what character he'd end up looking like though...

title: Re: My CK comic art
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Ah.. Now I see what you mean. Well, to explain my philosophy on Mort's design a little further, I was going for a sinister/cute/cool look (because the bad guys always look the coolest). Hence, the "cute" skull with flames. I gave him a t-shirt with jeans basically to make him the "inverse" of CK. I considered black jeans, but that seemed like it would be too much the black. Though now that you mention it, a black suit with black pants and a red tie (loosely worn) might look cool. Hmmmmmm.....[hr][/quote]

Mortimer has always struck me as too smart for logos and brands, he doesn't need to resort to the childish practice of labeling himself; he knows he's cool, he's the most intelligent being in the universe; if anything I think he'd be understated and ominous, the kind of person you'd stare at and go 'He can't possibly have done this, not one person, not all this, not all the evil?'[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

title: Re: More
content:
Well, I'm definitely going to do a continuing CK story via comic strips, but it won't be anything original (at least at the start). I just plan on following the storyline of the games, starting with Keen's landing on Mars... Maybe for episode 7....

At any rate, I was planning on just doing that whole thing via a new site on my blogger account, but maybe an actual comics hosting website makes more sense, though I'm not very familiar with how they work.. Galaxieretter, is that what yours is, or is it just server space where I'd have to make my own html pages? What's the URL?

At any rate, no CK strips for now as I'm working on another project that I pray will be completed over the weekend, but who knows. I also need to complete a few more strips of the continuing CK story before I publish those...

Okay, enough blathering... Here's a few more pics.. One old and one new...

Old... A Vorticon woman I call "Big Momma"...
[img]http://i206.photobucket.com/albums/bb125/bt-01/scrap-01b.jpg[/img]

title: Re: Episode 1 : strips 002, 003, 004
content:
Okay, at the risk of sounding redundant in my self-criticism, these next three strips are really really not great. I think I know why they're not great from a build-up/timing/clarity/consistency standpoint, but I decided to just throw them out there anyway and move things right along and see where it all ends up -- if anywhere. Strip 003 is especially frustrating because it's just too wordy, and the Yorp's face in the last panel.... he's supposed to be putting his lips on the glass and puffing out his cheeks, but why he does this even I don't know (it just seemed like it would be funny when I thought it up). Observations/critique/comments always welcome.

Anyway, here you go... And to quote George Carlin in Bill and Ted's... "They do get better." [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopefish.gif[/img]

[quote]Quote:[hr]Your Keen character suffers from the same one my own does; too much neck! I think when Keen goes into profile, you've got to really consider where his shoulders are, relative to the base of his helmet. Even looking at the PCKF logo, from the Keen5 title screen, you can see that Keen's neck is eclipsed by the helmet--it shouldn't ally be visible, in profile. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] [hr][/quote]
Thanks for the comments, that kind of thing is always welcome..

As far as the neck visibility issue, I don't think it has to do with too much neck as much as too little helmet... Because considering that the helmet is supposed to belong to his older brother it probably shouldn't fit quite as snug as I draw it... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-helmet.gif[/img] But to be frank, it's just easier to draw that way... Another factor is that my way of drawing the helmet makes it look less like a football helmet and more like something off a "Spaceballs" uniform... Normal football helmets are more flat on the sides and do cover the neck more since they are a tad longer on the side (I think).

That is a good observation though and considering that my character designs are still evolving, I'll take it into consideration as I develop the story.

Another thing to note is that I have to basically cut CK's helmet in half when drawing him in profile... Because if I drew the full helmet it would obscure his face... The game kind of does this too though so I don't feel too bad about it... :shrug:

[Edit: Had to add the helmet icon because it was just so appropriate. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] ]

title: Re: say...
content:
As an artist I saw that you ran into the same problem I did and that is how to show emotion with only one eye. Yorps are difficult to show emotion with because you don't have eyebrows to play around with, only an eyelid.

On a garg you can cheat because they have two eyes but a yorp has one. Believe it or not the eyebrows are an important part in a character's face. (Which is why I so prominently draw eyebrows. Eyebrows and mouth are all you need for emotion in cartoons, but I digress.)

The next time you want to show an emotion on a yorps face draw more "skin" on the top. This will give you more to "work with" so to speak. Also, let the eye sink into the eyesocket. It helps a LOT, especially when you need a yorp to pull off a "sly" or "shifty eyes" look. Let the eye roll back while skin gets pulled over the eyes. This, more or less, is how eyes work anyway. (You probably saw on TV where people who could bug out their eyes really far from their head.)

This works to your advantage in two ways. First off you are basing your model off of nature, the way things actually work (Just exaggerating it majorly since it is a cartoon.) and second will allow you to better use the eyelid to create emotion.

If you want some examples to look at I suggest looking at how I draw yorps for my webcomic.

[url=http://www.blegdandsmeeg.com/comic.php]www.blegdandsmeeg.com/comic.php[/url]

ALSO if you want to see the same problem in a different way I highly suggest watching a few later episodes of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ReBoot]Reboot[/url]. (Reboot was the first computer animated... thing to air on television. [predates Toy Story by many years] It was groundbreaking for its time and even now still raises my eyebrows.)

(HEY COOL! They are reviving Reboot! Even a webcomic! Childhood nostalgia to the MAX!)

Anyway, in Reboot there are many different kinds of... people. The most simple is a "binome". A "Binome" is either a 1 or a 0 shaped generic guy. (They were used as background extras pretty much.) Well the problem with the 1's is that they only have ONE EYE!

Sounds like a yorp problem. The way they worked around not having enough eyebrows is... stunning. In season 3 Herr Doktor's (HA!) eye expressions are the best I have ever saw done with only one eye. (I want to be able to get a video clip soon... just as soon as I can figure out this video USB capture device.)
I found a good clip on You Tube of Reboot in which you see a lot of closeups of the "one" binomes and the way their eyes work.

[url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KmAy0NyG6vI]www.youtube.com/watch?v=KmAy0NyG6vI[/url]

Even if it doesn't help you I am SURE it is worth a good laugh. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

I hope to GOD this helped you. I mean... it took me 3 months just to figure out WHAT I need to do in order to translate the muscles on your forehand in to a single eyelid. I have pages upon pages of smeeg eye sketches (And some mouths too.) so if you want to look at them I will gladly scan them in for you. (I just need to find the right sketchbook... I have so many. >_<

Also if you have a question or want to discuss this further feel free to drop me a line. Drawing emotion, not necessarily one eyed emotion, but drawing cartoonish facial expressions is something I spent most of my teen aged years working out and my knowledge in that area is extensive. (Although I severely lack in other areas because of this, such as human anatomy.) There are a few ways to contact me. One is through this forum (Send me a Private Message) my profile (My AIM is on there.) and my Deviant Art. Not to mention I also have my email on my webcomic page.

EXCELLENT illustrations by the way. Simply stunning. I really am enjoying this little bit of Keen fanwork. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Marvelous, keep it up! (Please?)-----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.

title: Re: CK010
content:
What Gal said.

You'd want to be prepared to create at least three per week and only release two of them. Some weeks you may be stuck, or too busy to work on the comic, and for those times you'd want a buffer to work with. Other times you may be in the flow like the other week when you created a whole stack of quality comics, but you don't want to spoil your audience by releasing them all at once.

You could even just release one per week, and aim to create two or three. If you end up ahead by a month, then jack it up to releasing two a week.

I look forward to it, either way.

[quote]Quote:[hr]You'd want to be prepared to create at least three per week and only release two of them. Some weeks you may be stuck, or too busy to work on the comic, and for those times you'd want a buffer to work with. Other times you may be in the flow like the other week when you created a whole stack of quality comics, but you don't want to spoil your audience by releasing them all at once.[hr][/quote]
That's pretty much my plan. I already have a bit of a buffer going. My philosophy about strips is that when I sit down to start drawing one I don't get up until it's complete. Hence why I'm so often appologizing for messy art whilst not taking the time to correct said messy art. But the schedule is as much for my own happiness as anything else, because it helps put keep everything in order. Plus, if I didn't have that philosophy, I'll admit to you right now that I would never get anything done... ever. And I don't write a script for a strip until I have the complete idea in my head. All in all it helps me use my time more efficiently (in theory).

At any rate, if I don't keep to the schedule I give you permission to verbally beat me senseless. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-bloody.gif[/img] That should help too. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

That's why I didn't set any release date for my mods and game engine, because I need inspiration for working on them, and inspiration is not easy to get; you simply can't buy inspiration even if you have money (although, perhaps if you go to the rl district...).------------------------------

title: Re: My CK comic art
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]And plants can have teeth, silica ones.[hr][/quote]

Believe me, when you've had to harvest squash all summer, you learn to respect this fact, you need gloves or your hands become red and infected, slashed through thousands of times by a million small spikes. Nettle spikes too are silica, and the 'teeth' of venus flytraps are hardened with it. Heck, you can even identify fossil dirt by looking at what silica grains plants have left in it. If you want, I could go on, I passed my third form biology paper by talking about this.

[quote]Quote:[hr]Thanks, though I'm definitely not the master Bill Watterson... I can't imagine Watterson would make a comic of another person's creation especially considering what a stickler he is about copyright infringements.[hr][/quote]

You want to see his earlier work then, it was nowhere near as polished as C&H. Watterson isn't too bad when it comes to copyright infringements, he seems to have a healthy respect for them (After, I believe, drawing Snoopy for a school contest and being disqualified.) Certainly he hates merchandising far, far more. He's mentioned in many places taking material from things like Peanuts and Krazy Kat, even entire landscapes.

His martian alien was green and had one eye too...[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!

title: Re: My CK comic art
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Certainly he hates merchandising far, far more[hr][/quote]He certain hates other people bastardizing his characters for profit. ("I clearly miscalculated how popular it would be to show Calvin urinating on a Ford logo") But did you ever see that C&H animation that was on Youtube for a while? It was only on there a couple of days before Bill asked them to take it down. I guess Youtube would be making money off that so I suppose it would be considered as being for profit...

[quote]Quote:[hr]He's mentioned in many places taking material from things like Peanuts and Krazy Kat, even entire landscapes.[hr][/quote]Peanuts and Krazy Kat (and Pogo I think) were his major influences (which is a far cry from copyright infringement), but I don't recall ever saying that he's lifted material directly from those save for one time in an early Sunday strip when he presented a Krazy Kat landscape as a painting in a museum (it's the one where Calvin rampages through the museum as a T Rex).

How long has C&H been out of print anyway, 10 or 15 years? Makes me feel old. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-oldy.gif[/img]
